Quote: “As the taxi moved, I started checking out all the new buildings and streets. It was clear that whereas some people had gotten better off, others were worse off or had simply stagnated. Infrastructure reveals so much about a place and its culture, politics, and people. The disparities between the poor and the rich neighborhoods…show that ‘time’ was not ticking at the same pace for everyone. Time was not moving favorably for everyone. Even time is like power in that it moves some people forward, some backward, and some to the sides and the margins. Time also buries some people under the ground.”
Author: ― Louis Yako, Bullets in Envelopes: Iraqi Academics in Exile
Other Tags: [' change, greed, income-inequality, inequality, infrastructure, inspirational, time, wealth, wisdom']

Quote: “Some say time does not exist. I say time exists for Love. Why? The apparent existence of time exists not to feel alone, to experience Companionship, to experience Love. Love can only be experienced through the perception of time. Time exists so Self would not feel alone. Aloneness aka loneliness is the cause and Companionship aka Love us the purpose. Self perceives time not to feel alone. Self perceives time for Companionship. Self perceives time to Love and Be Loved in return. At any time, there is only One Self desiring Love. As such; the purpose of time is Love. If the above is not understood, the word 'Self' may be replaced with 'One', 'I', 'God', 'Allah', 'Brahman', 'The Tao', et al until it is understood that it's all G-d and that the meaning- and purpose of Life is Love, Sweet Love. As such the following statement is equally correct. God perceives time not to feel alone. God perceives time for Companionship. God perceives time to Love and Be Loved in return. All that is here is God desiring Love. Love is the purpose, there is no purpose but Love.”
Author: ― Wald Wassermann

Quote: “Saigon time was fourteen hours off, although if one judged time by this clock, it was we who were fourteen hours off. Refugee, exile, immigrant--whatever species of displaced human we were, we did not simply live in two cultures, as celebrants of the great American melting pot imagined. Displaced people also lived in two time zones, the here and the there, the present and the past, being as we were reluctant time travelers. But while science fiction imagined time travelers as moving forward or backward in time, this timepiece demonstrated a different chronology. The open secret of the clock, naked for all to see, was that we were only going in circles.”
Author: ― Viet Thanh Nguyen, The Sympathizer
Other Tags: [' america, clocks, displacement, east-vs-west, exile, past, present, refugees, time, vietnam']

Kuidas saab muuta elu kulgu kõigest ühe tolmusel teel lausutud sõnaga, kui too tee ise on kõigest kui nõelaga veetud kriips, üürike ajas ja nõrguke Aafrika mägedest krobelisel koorel? Kuhu mujale kui tuulde võiks too sõna õigupoolest lennata?”
Author: ― Beryl Markham, West with the Night
Other Tags: [' time, wondering']

Quote: “Did he expect to be in a hurry coming down? Maybe, Leaphorn thought. Maybe that was it. Time. But Navajos didn't hurry. In fact, there was no word in the Navajo language for time.”
Author: ― Tony Hillerman, The Blessing Way
Other Tags: [' navajo-language, time']

Quote: “We had invented time, and we could not kill it fast enough. After dinner, dancing, and baths, we read, wrote our poems and stories, brushed our teeth, and tumbled into bed, only to find the next day was exactly the same. We had not moved one inch forward in the night. It was like prison, not in the punishment but in the vast sameness of the days. We were impossibly rich in time, and we lavished the excess on one another.”
Author: ― Ann Patchett, Truth and Beauty
Other Tags: [' friendship, time']

Quote: “It happened forty years ago. It hurts me in some ways more now than it did then, now that I know what a thing like that can mean to a life beyond what it does when it’s happening.”
Author: ― Allison Moorer, Blood: A Memoir
Other Tags: [' loss, time']

Quote: “No single week seemed so different from any other week, and yet the years did.”
Author: ― S.R. Hughes, The War Beneath
Other Tags: [' time, time-passing']

Quote: “Time passed. Warehouses shed exoskeletons and became artist lofts. Collapsing Victorians and colonials slouched into their roles as homeless shelters. The suburbs hunched into Squatter City. Malleus Industries International relocated its North American East offices to Oceanrest. Highrises sprouted overnight, a newborn downtown squealing in glass and neon. Oceanrest shivered out from its old skin. Everything became something else, eventually.”
Author: ― S.R. Hughes, The War Beneath
Other Tags: [' change, city, cycles, time, time-passing']

Quote: “There are tons of things I could and probably should be doing for work right now. But at some point, you have to put it aside and get busy with the things that really matter.”
Author: ― Lisa Wingate, Tending Roses
Other Tags: [' family, important-things-in-life, rest, time']

Quote: “Time passes... but memories do not.”
Author: ― Lisa Wingate, Tending Roses
Other Tags: [' memories, time']

Quote: “...The best times of my life, the times that passed by me the most quickly, were the times when the roses grew wild.”
Author: ― Lisa Wingate, Tending Roses
Other Tags: [' family, love, time']

Quote: “None of the day is long enough to complete/achieve the work; we deliberately avoid undertaking or finishing. Start on time to accomplish on time.”
Author: ― Shahenshah Hafeez Khan
Other Tags: [' completion, task, time']

Quote: “Um ein Programm jedoch optimal einsetzen zu können, ist die Kenntnis seiner Leistungsfähigkeit nötig und auch die Routine im Umgang. Das bedeutet in der Praxis, daß man Stunden am Computer verbringt, die vielleicht besser draußen in der Natur mit dem Camcorder genutzt wären.”
Author: ― Walter Schild, Videografieren perfekt: Profitricks für Aufnahmetechnik und Nachbearbeitung
Other Tags: [' computer, nature, programmes, time']

Quote: “Thought is the movement of time”
Author: ― Jiddu Krishnamurti
